Playbooks.Name: Cutter
Playbooks.XPTrigger: Address a challenge with violence or coercion.

Specials.Name: Battleborn
Specials.Description: You may expend your special armor to reduce harm from an attack in combat or to push yourself during a fight.

Specials.Name: Bodyguard
Specials.Description: When you protect a teammate, take +1d to your resistance roll. When you gather info to anticipate possible threats in the current situation, you get +1 effect.

Specials.Name: Ghost Fighter
Specials.Description: You may imbue your hands, melee weapons, or tools with spirit energy. You gain potency in combat vs. the supernatural. You may grapple with spirits to restrain and capture them.

Specials.Name: Leader
Specials.Description: When you Command a cohort in combat, they continue to fight when they would otherwise break (they’re not taken out when they suffer level 3 harm). They gain +1 effect and 1 armor.

Specials.Name: Mule
Specials.Description: Your load limits are higher. Light: 5. Normal: 7. Heavy: 8.

Specials.Name: Not to be Trifled With
Specials.Description: You can push yourself to do one of the following: perform a feat of physical force that verges on the superhuman—engage a small gang on equal footing in close combat.

Specials.Name: Savage
Specials.Description: When you unleash physical violence, it’s especially frightening. When you Command a frightened target, take +1d.

Specials.Name: Vigorous
Specials.Description: You recover from harm faster. Permanently fill in one of your healing clock segments. Take +1d to healing treatment rolls.

Items.Name: Fine hand weapon
Items.Description: A finely crafted one-handed melee weapon of your choice.

Items.Name: Fine heavy weapon
Items.Description: A finely crafted two-handed melee weapon of your choice.

Items.Name: Scary weapon or tool
Items.Description: A scary-looking hand weapon or tool. This item grants increased effect when you intimidate, not increased harm in combat.

Items.Name: Manacles & chain
Items.Description: A set of heavy manacles and chain, suitable for restraining a prisoner.

Items.Name: Rage essence vial
Items.Description: A single dose, which greatly enhances the user’s strength, resistance to pain, and irrational aggression for the span of several minutes.

Playbooks.Name: Hound
Playbooks.XPTrigger: Address a challenge with tracking or violence.

Specials.Name: Sharpshooter
Specials.Description: You can push yourself to do one of the following: make a ranged attack at extreme distance beyond what’s normal for the weapon—unleash a barrage of rapid fire to suppress the enemy.

Specials.Name: Focused
Specials.Description: You may expend your special armor to resist a consequence of surprise or mental harm (fear, confusion, losing track of someone) or to push yourself for ranged combat or tracking.

Specials.Name: Ghost Hunter
Specials.Description: Your hunting pet is imbued with spirit energy. It gains potency when tracking or fighting the supernatural, and gains an arcane ability: ghost-form, mind-link, or arrow-swift. Take this ability again to choose an additional arcane ability for your pet.

Specials.Name: Scout
Specials.Description: When you gather information to discover the location of a target, you get +1 effect. When you hide in a prepared position or use camouflage you get +1d to rolls to avoid detection.

Specials.Name: Survivor
Specials.Description: From hard-won experience or occult ritual, you are immune to the poisonous miasma of the deathlands and are able to subsist on the strange flora and fauna there. You get +1 stress box.

Specials.Name: Tough as Nails
Specials.Description: Penalties from harm are one level less severe (though level 4 harm is still fatal).

Specials.Name: Vengeful
Specials.Description: You gain an additional XPTrigger: You got payback against someone who harmed you or someone you care about. If your crew helped you get payback, also mark crew xp.

Items.Name: Fine pair of pistols
Items.Description: A matched pair of handguns, made for greater accuracy, with double barrels that allow for two shots before reloading.

Items.Name: Fine long rifle
Items.Description: A finely crafted hunting rifle, deadly at long range, unwieldy in close quarters.

Items.Name: Electroplasmic ammunition
Items.Description: A bandolier of electroplasmic ammo, especially potent against spirits, but less effective against physical targets. The electrical charge is enough to stun a person, but does very little real harm. Several hits might incapacitate a human target. This ammunition is especially reactive in the ghost field—make a 4-clock called 'Attention from the Spirit Wardens' and tick it for every operation in which this ammo was used.

Items.Name: A trained hunting pet
Items.Description: Your animal companion obeys your commands and anticipates your actions. Cohort (Expert: Hunter).

Items.Name: Spyglass
Items.Description: A brass tube with lenses that allow long-distance vision. Collapsible. May attach to a rifle.

Playbooks.Name: Leech
Playbooks.XPTrigger: Address a challenge with technical skill or mayhem.

Specials.Name: Alchemist
Specials.Description: When you invent or craft a creation with alchemical features, you get +1 result level to your roll (a 1-3 becomes a 4/5, etc.). You begin with one special formula already known.

Specials.Name: Analyst
Specials.Description: During downtime, you get two ticks to distribute among any long term project clocks that involve investigation or learning a new formula or design plan.

Specials.Name: Artificer
Specials.Description: When you invent or craft a creation with spark-craft features, you get +1 result level to your roll (a 1-3 becomes a 4/5, etc.). You begin with one special design already.

Specials.Name: Fortitude
Specials.Description: You may expend your special armor to resist a consequence of fatigue, weakness, or chemical effects, or to push yourself when working with technical skill or handling alchemicals.

Specials.Name: Ghost Ward
Specials.Description: When you Wreck an area with arcane substances, ruining it for any other use, it becomes anathema or enticing to spirits (your choice).

Specials.Name: Physicker
Specials.Description: You can Tinker with bones, blood, and bodily humours to treat wounds or stabilize the dying. You may Study a malady or corpse. Everyone in your crew (including you) gets +1d to their healing treatment rolls.

Specials.Name: Saboteur
Specials.Description: When you Wreck, your work is much quieter than it should be and the damage is very well-hidden from casual inspection.

Specials.Name: Venomous
Specials.Description: Choose a drug or poison (from your bandolier stock) to which you have become immune. You can push yourself to secrete it through your skin or saliva or exhale it as a vapor.

Items.Name: Fine tinkering tools
Items.Description: A finely crafted set of tools for detailed mechanist work. A jeweler’s loupe. Measuring devices.

Items.Name: Fine wrecking tools
Items.Description: A specialized set of tools for sabotage and destruction. A small, powerful drill. A mallet and steel spikes. A prybar. An electroplasmic battery, clamps, wire. Vials of acid. A spark-torch cutter and fuel tank.

Items.Name: Blowgun & darts, syringes
Items.Description: A small tube and darts that can be filled from alchemy flasks. Empty syringes.

Items.Name: Bandolier
Items.Description: A strap worn across the body, fitted with specially-padded pouches to hold three alchemical agents or spark-craft bombs. When you employ an alchemical or bomb from a bandolier, choose one from the list at right (or one of your custom-made formulas). See page 226 for more on alchemicals and bombs.

Items.Name: Gadgets
Items.Description: You may create gadgets during downtime by Tinkering with tools and materials. See Gadgets, page 227.

Playbooks.Name: Lurk
Playbooks.XPTrigger: Address a challenge with stealth or evasion.

Specials.Name: Infiltrator
Specials.Description: You are not affected by quality or Tier when you bypass security measures.

Specials.Name: Ambush
Specials.Description: When you attack from hiding or spring a trap, you get +1d to your roll.

Specials.Name: Daredevil
Specials.Description: When you roll a desperate action, you get +1d to your roll if you also take -1d to any resistance rolls against consequences from your action.

Specials.Name: The Devil's Footsteps
Specials.Description: You can push yourself to do one of the following: perform a feat of athletics that verges on the superhuman—maneuver to confuse your enemies so they mistakenly attack each other.

Specials.Name: Expertise
Specials.Description: Choose one of your action ratings. When you lead a group action using that action, you can suffer only 1 stress at most, regardless of the number of failed rolls.

Specials.Name: Ghost Veil
Specials.Description: You may shift partially into the ghost field, becoming shadowy and insubstantial for a few moments. Take 2 stress when you shift, plus 1 stress for each extra feature: it lasts for a few minutes rather than moments—you are invisible rather than shadowy—you may float through the air like a ghost.

Specials.Name: Reflexes
Specials.Description: When there’s a question about who acts first, the answer is you.

Specials.Name: Shadow
Specials.Description: You may expend your special armor to resist a consequence from detection or security measures, or to push yourself for a feat of athletics or stealth.

Items.Name: Fine lockpicks
Items.Description: A finely crafted set of tools to disable and circumvent locks.

Items.Name: Fine shadow cloak
Items.Description: A hooded cloak made of rare Iruvian shadow-silk that blends into the darkness around it. This item improves your effect level when you sneak around.

Items.Name: Light climbing gear
Items.Description: A well-crafted set of climbing gear that is less bulky and heavy than a standard set.

Items.Name: Silence potion vial
Items.Description: A vial of golden liquid that negates all sound within 10 paces of the drinker for a span of several moments.

Items.Name: Dark-sight goggles
Items.Description: An arcane device that allows the wearer to see in pitch darkness as if it were well-lit.

Playbooks.Name: Slide
Playbooks.XPTrigger: Address a challenge with deception or influence.

Starters.Title: The Grifter
Starters.Special: A Little Something on the Side

Specials.Name: Rook's Gambit
Specials.Description: Take 2 stress to roll your best action rating while performing a different action. Say how you adapt your skill to this use.

Specials.Name: Cloak & Dagger
Specials.Description: When you use a disguise or other form of covert misdirection, you get +1d to rolls to confuse or deflect suspicion. When you throw off your disguise, the resulting surprise gives you the initiative in the situation.

Specials.Name: Ghost Voice
Specials.Description: You know the secret method to interact with a ghost or demon as if it were a normal human, regardless of how wild or feral it appears. You gain potency when communicating with the supernatural.

Specials.Name: Like Looking into a Mirror
Specials.Description: You can always tell when someone is lying to you.

Specials.Name: A Little Something on the Side
Specials.Description: At the end of each downtime phase, you earn +2 stash.

Specials.Name: Mesmerism
Specials.Description: When you Sway someone, you may cause them to forget that it’s happened until they next interact with you.

Specials.Name: Subterfuge
Specials.Description: You may expend your special armor to resist a consequence from suspicion or persuasion, or to push yourself for subterfuge.

Specials.Name: Trust in Me
Specials.Description: You get +1d vs. a target with whom you have an intimate relationship.

Items.Name: Fine clothes & jewelry
Items.Description: An outfit that appears to be of such fine make as to pass you off as a wealthy noble. [0 load] If you’re carrying this item as a second outfit to change into, it counts as 2 load.

Items.Name: Fine disguise kit
Items.Description: A theatrical make-up kit equipped with an impressive array of expert appliances to fool the eye.

Items.Name: Fine loaded dice, trick cards
Items.Description: Gambling accouterments subtly altered to favor particular outcomes. The fine quality of this kit may increase the effect of your deceptive actions when you use it.

Items.Name: Trance powder
Items.Description: A dose of the popular drug, which induces an altered mental state. The victim of this powder is not fully unconscious, but rather retreats into a calm, suggestible mental state, similar to hypnotism.

Items.Name: A cane-sword
Items.Description: A slim sword and its sheath, disguised as a noble’s cane. The disguise will fool a cursory inspection. [1 load]

Playbooks.Name: Spider
Playbooks.XPTrigger: Address a challenge with calculation or conspiracy.

Specials.Name: Foresight
Specials.Description: Two times per score you can assist a teammate without paying stress. Describe how you prepared for this.

Specials.Name: Calculating
Specials.Description: Due to your careful planning, during downtime, you may give yourself or another crew member +1 downtime activity.

Specials.Name: Connected
Specials.Description: During downtime, you get +1 result level when you acquire an asset or reduce heat.

Specials.Name: Functioning Vice
Specials.Description: When you indulge your vice, you may adjust the dice outcome by 1 or 2 (up or down). An ally who joins you may do the same.

Specials.Name: Ghost Contract
Specials.Description: ghost contract When you shake on a deal or draft one in writing, you and your partner —human or otherwise—both bear a mark of your oath. If either breaks the contract, they take level 3 harm, 'Cursed.'

Specials.Name: Jail Bird
Specials.Description: When incarcerated, your wanted level counts as 1 less, your Tier as 1 more, and you gain +1 faction status with a faction that you help while you’re inside, in addition to whatever you get from the incarceration roll.

Specials.Name: Mastermind
Specials.Description: You may expend your special armor to protect a teammate, or to push yourself when you gather information or work on a long-term project.

Specials.Name: Weaving the Web
Specials.Description: You gain +1d to Consort when you gather information on a target for a score. You get +1d to the engagement roll for that operation.

Items.Name: Fine cover identity
Items.Description: Paperwork, planted stories and rumors, and false relationships sufficient to pass as a different person.

Items.Name: Fine bottle of whiskey
Items.Description: A rare distillation from your personal collection, potent both in its alcohol and its ability to impress.

Items.Name: Blueprints
Items.Description: A folio of useful architectural drawings and city plans. Feel free to specify which plans you’re carrying when you choose this item.

Items.Name: Vial of slumber essence
Items.Description: A dose of slumber essence sufficient to put someone to sleep for an hour. The victim’s sleep isn’t supernatural, but it is deep—they can be roused with some effort.

Items.Name: Concealed palm pistol
Items.Description: A small firearm with a weak charge, easily concealed in a sleeve or waistcoat. This pistol has extremely limited range; only a few feet. It’s very difficult to detect on your person, even if you’re searched.

Playbooks.Name: Whisper
Playbooks.XPTrigger: Address a challenge with knowledge or arcane power.

Specials.Name: Compel
Specials.Description: You can Attune to the ghost field to force a nearby ghost to appear before you and obey an order you give it. You are not supernaturally terrified by a ghost you summon or attempt to compel (though your allies may be).

Specials.Name: Ghost Mind
Specials.Description: You’re always aware of supernatural entities in your presence. Take +1d whenever you gather information about the supernatural by any means.

Specials.Name: Iron Will
Specials.Description: You are immune to the terror that some supernatural entities inflict on sight. When you make a resistance roll with Resolve, take +1d.

Specials.Name: Occultist
Specials.Description: You know the secret ways to Consort with ancient powers, forgotten gods, or demons. Once you’ve consorted with one, you get +1d to Command cultists who worship it.

Specials.Name: Ritual
Specials.Description: You know the arcane methods to perform ritual sorcery. You can Study an occult ritual (or create a new one) to summon a supernatural effect or being. You begin with one ritual already learned.

Specials.Name: Strange Methods
Specials.Description: When you invent or craft a creation with arcane features, get +1 result level to your roll (a 1-3 becomes a 4/5, etc.). You begin with one arcane design already known.

Specials.Name: Tempest
Specials.Description: You can push yourself to do one of the following: unleash a stroke of lightning as a weapon—summon a storm in your immediate vicinity (torrential rain, roaring winds, heavy fog, chilling frost and snow, etc.).

Specials.Name: Warded
Specials.Description: You may expend your special armor to resist a supernatural consequence, or to push yourself when you contend with or employ arcane forces.

Items.Name: Fine lightning hook
Items.Description: A long, two-handed pole with a loop of heavy wire at the end, connected to an electroplasmic capacitor. Suitable for grappling a spirit and dragging it into a spirit bottle. This custom-made hook collapses into a compact form, thus reducing its load to 1, even though it’s two-handed.

Items.Name: Fine spirit mask
Items.Description: An arcane item that allows the trained user to see supernatural energies in great detail. Also affords some measure of protection against ghostly possession. Each spirit mask is unique. What does yours look like? What makes it strange and disturbing to see?

Items.Name: Spirit bottles (2)
Items.Description: An arcane device used to trap a spirit. A metal and crystalline cylinder, the size of a loaf of bread.

Items.Name: Ghost key
Items.Description: An arcane device that can open ghost doors. There’s an echo of the entire city, across the ages, trapped in the ghost field. Sometimes a door to that place can be found.

Items.Name: Demonbane charm
Items.Description: An arcane trinket that demons prefer to avoid.
